events.title: US says 11 people killed in latest strikes on alleged drug boats

events.description: Google and Mark Zuckerberg's Meta have been accused of deliberately making platforms addictive to children and harming their mental health.

events.title: Europe looks to Australia's social media ban for kids
events.description: Germany has joined the growing list of EU nations that are considering banning children from social media. Australia has banned youths from social media since December ‚Äî and its example has lessons for EU governments.

events.title: Greenland: Denmark's King Frederik X visits Nuuk
events.description: King Frederik is visiting the partly autonomous Danish territory of Greenland, following the tensions prompted by US President Donald Trump last month.

events.title: North Korean POWs stuck in Ukraine as Seoul hesitates
events.description: Two North Korean soldiers in Ukraine have asked to move to South Korea rather than facing dire consequences for letting themselves be captured in the North. The regime might choose to punish their families instead.

events.title: South Africa sends in troops to combat organized crime
events.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa's decision to deploy the military to battle fight crime has elicited mixed reactions from South Africans. Analysts say public confidence can only be restored through a policing overhaul.

events.title: India AI summit: Brazil's Lula lands, US giants tout plans
events.description: Brazil's President Lula da Silva has arrived in New Delhi, while Google and Nvidia hail Indian expansion plans. Meanwhile, China felt the sting of intellectual property appropriation for once in a robot dog scandal.

events.title: Berlinale: Women from Iran, Afghanistan debut bold films
events.description: These two female filmmakers express the injustice they've experienced in their home countries in contrasting genres: a romantic comedy ‚Äî and a nightmarish drama.

events.title: UK condemns 'appalling' 10-year sentence for British couple held in Iran
events.description: A British couple detained in Iran since January 2025 have been sentenced to 10 years in jail for espionage, their family announced on Thursday. The UK government has condemned the prison terms for Lindsay and Craig Foreman as "completely appalling and totally unjustifiable".

events.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta's policies on children at landmark social media trial
events.description: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg defended the company‚Äôs policies on children and platform design during a landmark US trial examining whether social media firms knowingly harmed young users, as internal documents and testimony highlighted tensions between safety claims and growth strategies.

events.title: South Korea court sentences ex-president Yoon to life in prison for 2024 insurrection
events.description: A South Korean court on Thursday found ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol guilty of leading an insurrection for his short-lived attempt to impose martial law in December 2024, sentencing the former leader to life imprisonment.

events.title: Mourinho has 'failed us' over racism row, says ex-Man Utd star
events.description: Former Manchester United player Mikael Silvestre has claimed Jose Mourinho has "failed us" over his response to Vinicius Junior's allegations of racist abuse.

events.title: Ex-Victoria's Secret mogul says Epstein 'stole vast sums from our family'
events.description: A billionaire mogul says paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein stole vast sums from his family.

events.title: As Trump criticises Chagos deal again - what is in the controversial agreement?
events.description: Donald Trump has once again criticised the UK's decision to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, in a deal that includes a formal transfer of Diego Garcia, home to a key US military base.

events.title: 'Outrageous' Russia decision sees Ukrainian officials boycott Winter Paralympics
